title: Human Remains Found at China Eastern Airlines Plane Crash Site
sub_head: Rainfall in the mountainous terrain leads to suspension of rescue efforts
body:
HONG KONG—Heavy rain hampered search efforts on Wednesday after more than 2,000 rescuers, armed with shovels and flashlights, combed through mountainous terrain and began discovering human remains from the site of a Boeing 737 crash in southern China.
The wreckage of the plane, which carried 132 people, was strewn across a hilly, forested area in a rural part of China’s Guangxi region. An army of rescuers—including soldiers and firefighters—and excavators dug into the land where the crash’s impact wiped out trees and a terraced field, video from state broadcaster China Central Television showed.
